meaningMnemonic: You know that 裂く is "to tear" or "to rip up." So, if you're trying to tear or rip up something, and you're <kanji>pull</kanji>ing it at the same time, you are going <vocabulary>to tear up</vocabulary> that thing, or more accurately perhaps <vocabulary>to tear off</vocabulary> something, since you're pulling.
readingMnemonic: The reading comes from 引く and 裂く.
